intro: Tulipa uzbekistanica, commonly known as the Uzbek tulip, is a species native to Central Asia, particularly Uzbekistan. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces showy, cup-shaped flowers in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in arid conditions, and it thrives in well-drained soils. The flowers bloom in spring, adding vibrant color to its natural habitat.
